image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of Richard Marles in a suit and tie speaking at a media conference outdoors.

props.synopsis: The defence minister insists the milestone agreement on AUKUS does not oblige Australia to take nuclear waste from the United States or United Kingdom.

title.children: 'No circumstance' under which Australia would take nuclear waste from US and UK, defence minister says

image.altText: qhday13

props.synopsis: From a masked shot putter to an emotional tribute for a much-loved dog, here are the bits and pieces you might have missed from Paris on day 13.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Masked shot putter steals the limelight, daughters of footy stars shine in the pool, and gold medallist pays tribute to dead dog

image.altText: A flag with the letter CFMEU on a building site with an urban backdrop

props.synopsis: The federal government will introduce laws to force the CFMEU to accept an administrator, after the construction union failed to consent to doing so.

title.children: 'Urgent action is required': Laws to be introduced to force CFMEU to accept administrator, after union fails to consent

image.altText: A pixelated image of a child. The image is of a stock model

props.synopsis: Instagram is still allowing parents to sell content of their children, including bikini photos and videos, despite claiming it stopped the practice three months ago.

title.children: On Instagram, parents are selling 'exclusive' photos of their children and Meta is struggling to clamp down

image.altText: Screengrab of bodycam vision of three men in fatigues on a roof.

props.synopsis: Newly released footage shows a police officer spotting Thomas Crooks just seconds before the attempt on Donald Trump's life.

title.children: New bodycam footage shows moment police confronted Donald Trump's alleged shooter

image.altText: A stock market watcher stands in front of an ASX board.

props.synopsis: A week after US jobs data sent global financial markets into a panic, a strong rally on Wall Street has seen the S&P 500 record its best day since November 2022 — erasing almost all of the losses from earlier this week. Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares follow Wall Street's lead after jobs data calms recession fears

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China’s consumer prices rise faster than expected in July
Nick Scali's share price falls as profit plunges

image.altText: Katy Gallagher kneels down next to a child playing with toy dinosaurs.

props.synopsis: Finance Minister Katy Gallagher says the federal government is working towards a goal of universal early child education, a day after announcing a $3.6 billion wage increase for workers.

title.children: Pay rise for workers a step towards universal early childhood education, as Gallagher says 'more work to be done'

image.altText: A Titan submersible underwater.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for his estate claim the crew onboard the submersible knew they were going to die before the implosion and they experienced "terror and mental anguish".

title.children: Crew of Titan sub knew they were going to die before implosion, lawsuit claims

image.altText: A composite image shows Khaleda Zia on the left and Sheikh Hasina on the right.

props.synopsis: As Bangladesh looks for a new leader after the former prime minister quit and fled the country following weeks of violent protests, a few key names have begun to emerge, including one of Sheikh Hasina's greatest foes.

title.children: Protesters drove Bangladesh's leader out of the country and now her long-term rival is back on the scene

image.altText: Water polo

props.synopsis: Australia defeats the US in a tense penalty shootout to book a place in the women's water polo final for the first time since Sydney 2000.

title.children: Hugs and tears as Australia stuns defending water polo champs the US to book a place in the Olympics final

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair after running in a race

props.synopsis: When did he test positive, and why did he run? Noah Lyles explains his first 200m loss in three years, and why he's proud for competing with COVID.

title.children: From the world's fastest man to a wheelchair: COVID-hit Lyles explains final fade out

image.altText: A building on fire

props.synopsis: In one of the biggest attacks by Ukraine on Russia of the two-year war, about 1,000 Ukrainian troops crossed the Russian border on Tuesday with tanks and armoured vehicles, covered in the air by swarms of drones and pounding artillery.

title.children: Russia battles Ukrainian troops for a third day after major incursion into Russian territory

image.altText: Rohan Damle holds a bow and arrow.

props.synopsis: The plight of two New Zealand pilots in West Papua — one killed and another held hostage — highlights the risks faced by pilots in the region. However, the conflict is not the only danger. Here's why so many Australians and New Zealanders work there anyway.

title.children: It's dangerous work for a pilot in West Papua. So why fly there?

image.altText: Image of a Foxtel logo.

props.synopsis: Local pay television platform Foxtel is up for sale, News Corp global chief executive Robert Thomson has revealed after the company delivered its full year earnings results.

title.children: News Corp is looking to sell off Foxtel, chief executive tells shareholders

image.altText: A smiling Kamala Harris speaks at a podium, holding a finger to the sky.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris is riding a wave of Democratic enthusiasm, and polls suggest the election has become more competitive. But three months is a long time in modern US politics.

title.children: The Kamala Harris honeymoon period is in full swing, but how long can it last?

image.altText: A man gestures widely with both hands while talking behind a lectern

props.synopsis: As the dust settles on his ignominious departure last year, the grim reality is that – even after the so-called penalty – Joyce will still walk away with about $13 million for his final year.

title.children: 'Mistakes were made': Why Joyce's remuneration package is under the spotlight

image.altText: Council workers dismantle a tent

props.synopsis: Homeless Brisbane man Bane Dancey says he doesn't know where he'll sleep at night after the council removed his tent during a clean-up operation.

title.children: Council takes away rough sleeper's tent during Homelessness Week

image.altText: Mariafe Artacho del Solar dives full lenth and attempts to dig the ball

props.synopsis: It can be hard to draw your attention away from the Eiffel Tower when watching the beach volleyball in Paris, but as Australia and Brazil became locked in a gripping women's semifinal, every eye was locked on the court.

title.children: Under a glowing Eiffel Tower, Australia's beach volleyball golden girls become the main attraction

image.altText: An illustration of a red house with its lights off inside at night, a squirrel glider, bogong moth and magpie are outside.

props.synopsis: Neighbourhood lights can disrupt the lives of animals that are active during the day or night, but there are steps you can take to help them out.

title.children: Urban animals need darkness at night. Here's how three species handle artificial light

image.altText: Donald Trump stands at a podium at a campaign rally

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has agreed to debate Kamala Harris on America's ABC after previously suggesting he could back out of the scheduled debate.

title.children: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris to debate on US network

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks down and grimaces slightly during a press conference.

props.synopsis: With less than a year to go until the latest date for an election, the government is looking overwhelmed by its list of "still to do" and "issues outstanding" items.

title.children: The Albanese government is like a renter nervously getting ready for a home inspection

image.altText: A father holds his young son on rocks next to Browns Creek. Both are unclothed

props.synopsis: Set in the hills behind Yandina, on Queensland's Sunshine Coast, is the Starlight Community. Residents don't own their plots of land but become shareholders of the community and the focus is on living sustainably.

title.children: Off-grid community in Sunshine Coast rainforest still going strong after 50 years

image.altText: Moody image of a person dressed in dark work clothes

props.synopsis: More people are working from home in some capacity since COVID-19 lockdowns. But with more workers being called back to the office, what's actually more productive?

title.children: Are we more productive working from home or in the office? This is what the experts say

image.altText: A composite image of Adam Giles and Lia Finocchiaro.

props.synopsis: In 2016, the Country Liberal Party was sensationally booted from government in the Northern Territory. Eight years later, it could be returned to government after a long road back from the political wilderness.

title.children: After eight years in the political wilderness, the CLP hopes it can return to power in the NT

image.altText: An Indigenous man performs on stage with the Red Flag Dancers in ochre paint and red traditional dress.

props.synopsis: The two-decade story of the event also plots the rise of First Nations music in Australia, from trailblazers like Yothu Yindi and Gurrumul to Thelma Plum, Baker Boy and beyond.

title.children: Australian music would not be the same without the National Indigenous Music Awards

image.altText: Surgery room with a medical figure in a gown holding a box saying human organ for transplant

props.synopsis: International organisations are concerned about the "hidden" crime of commercial trade in human organs. So what is the best way to combat the black market?

title.children: When it comes to illegal organ harvesting, the organ seller tends to be prosecuted over the 'the medical elite'

image.altText: A woman seated outside reading the novel Pride and Prejudice.

props.synopsis: Despite having enjoyed good health most of her life, in March this year 52-year-old Alison White had a stroke which impacted a part of the brain that plays a key role in movement, speech and emotion.

title.children: Alison didn't realise she was having a stroke until she went to hospital

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: An investigation into a mental health facility at the centre of historical abuse allegations has been welcomed by former staff, patients and their loved ones after decades of advocacy.

title.children: A nurse says she saw 'evil' behaviour at Wolston Park Mental Hospital. Decades later, an investigation has been launched

image.altText: Jarred, Aurora and their two kids stand on a hill in Tuscany.

props.synopsis: In 2022, Jarred Holt and his family moved to Arezzo, a small town in Tuscany. Here's why they decided to come home.

title.children: Why Jarred and his family found living in Tuscany 'a lot harder than we were expecting'

image.altText: A white, golden labradoodle wanders around a backyard.

props.synopsis: For Noodle, life up until very recently has been inside a labradoodle breeding farm. Since that was shut down, he is learning what human kindness looks like — and his new owner says he seems to like it very much, if his waggly tail is any indicator.

title.children: Noodle slowly learning what life outside the 'puppy farm' is like, as huge rehoming effort continues

image.altText: A young boy and girl sitting at a desk with toothpaste and toothbrushes, the girl is brushing a set of large plastic teeth.

props.synopsis: Researchers say 78 per cent of children under the age of five in rural Victoria have higher rates of tooth decay, fillings and missing teeth — and brushing with unfluoridated water isn't helping.

title.children: Kindergartens teach kids to brush their teeth without water in trial to stop dental decay

image.altText: Abdumalik Khalokov and Charlie Senior perform synchronised back flips

props.synopsis: Caitlin Parker and Charlie Senior become the seventh and eighth boxers from Australia to win Olympic medals. But they fear they may not get another chance.

title.children: Bloodied but unbowed, Australia's boxers match 64-year record Olympic performance in the face of a boxing crisis

image.altText: A French BMX athlete falls below his bike in front of La Concorde

props.synopsis: Olympians in action are impressive to watch, even from your living room. But these alternate angles capture just how impressive their feats are.

title.children: In pictures: These alternate angles show the true scale of Olympic athleticism
